ai.summary: This is a demanding 31.6 km ridge walk in the UK, following the Mynydd Moel-Tyrrau Mawr ridge. It combines long distances with rugged, exposed terrain and significant elevation gain, making it suitable for experienced hikers seeking a true ridge adventure.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect exposed ridges with rocky, uneven paths, steep ascents and descents, potential boggy sections, and panoramic views. Navigation and weather can change quickly, so good map reading and route finding are essential.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day in exposed upland terrain. Check weather forecasts and daylight hours; wind and rain can make sections hazardous. Carry a map and compass (not relying solely on electronics), tell someone your route and expected finish time, and start early. Use appropriate footwear, avoid crossing saturated bogs, and turn back if conditions deteriorate.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support and grip
Layered clothing and a waterproof, breathable outer shell
Hat and gloves for wind and cold conditions
Map and compass (do not rely solely on GPS)
Water and high-energy food for a full day
First aid kit and emergency essentials
Trekking poles for stability on uneven ridges
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries

seo.meta_description: Tackle the 31.6 km Mynydd Moel-Tyrrau Mawr ridge walk in the UK. Tough, exposed ridges, long distance, gear tips and safety guidance for experienced hikers.
